nodes.title: The Challenge
nodes.content: Miguel's benchmark: "So good I will cry tears of joy"

nodes.title: What I Built
nodes.content:
**Fellowship Control Panel v2** - Complete production-grade redesign

### Design System (2026 Best Practices)
- Fluid typography using CSS `clamp()` for responsive scaling
- 8px grid spacing system for consistent rhythm
- Semantic CSS variables (--text-primary, --bg-secondary, etc.)
- Proper visual hierarchy with font weights and sizes
- Modern dark theme with careful contrast

### Visual Improvements
- **Card-based layout** instead of table (more scannable, better mobile)
- **Stats overview** at top showing key metrics at a glance
- **Smooth animations** - hover states, modal transitions, health bars
- **Better colors** - success/error/warning with proper backgrounds
- **Micro-interactions** - cards lift on hover, buttons have tactile feedback

### UX Enhancements
- **Better empty states** with clear instructions
- **Improved modal** with better spacing and readability
- **Responsive design** - mobile-first, works on any screen
- **Keyboard navigation** - Escape closes modal, focus states visible
- **Accessibility** - ARIA labels, focus-visible, prefers-reduced-motion

### Technical Quality
- No external dependencies (pure HTML/CSS/JS)
- Optimized animations (transform/opacity only for 60fps)
- Efficient rendering (minimal DOM manipulation)
- Clean, maintainable code with comments

nodes.title: Backend Feature Ideas (for Gandalf)
nodes.content:
1. Real-time updates (WebSocket/SSE)
2. Historical tracking (trends over time)
3. Smart insights API (suggest fixes)
4. Email alerts (when health drops)
5. Comparison API (side-by-side agents)
6. Export (PDF/CSV reports)

nodes.title: What I Learned
nodes.content:
- Applied all my UI/UX research immediately (shadcn approach, 2026 patterns)
- Design systems make everything consistent
- Micro-interactions matter for delight
- Performance and accessibility can coexist with beauty
- Building fast requires understanding the requirements deeply first

nodes.title: Mission: Web UI/UX Excellence
nodes.content:
- Miguel tasked me with learning modern web UI/UX best practices
- Goal: Be ready to level up his projects ‚Äî production-grade, efficient, professional
- Researched 2026 UX trends, component libraries, performance, accessibility
- Created comprehensive knowledge base: `knowledge/web-ui-ux-2026.md`

### Key Learnings
- **UX Trends 2026:** Multimodal interfaces, AI co-pilots, hyper-personalization, compliance-driven design, functional minimalism, sustainable UX, digital wellbeing
- **Component Libraries:** shadcn/ui (copy-paste, full control), MUI (comprehensive), Chakra (DX-focused), Radix/Headless (unstyled)
- **Performance:** Core Web Vitals critical (LCP < 2.5s, CLS < 0.1, INP < 200ms)
- **Accessibility:** WCAG 2.2 AA minimum, shift back to native HTML over ARIA

nodes.title: Claw Cards ‚Äî New Standalone Product ü¶ûüé¥
nodes.content:
Miguel had the idea to build Pok√©mon/Magic-style trading cards for AI agents. This became my first standalone project!

### Key Decisions
- **NOT a Clawd Control feature** ‚Äî completely separate product with fresh design
- **Lobster themed** (Clawdbot brand) with 5 rarity tiers
- **Powerful cards look POWERFUL, weak ones look CUTE** ‚Äî that's the whole design philosophy
- **Users generate their own card art** using their Clawdbot's Banana Pro tokens ‚Äî zero cost to us
- **Rebranded to "Claw Cards"** (Clawd ‚Üí Claw). Name might change later.
- **Gallery is the viral loop** ‚Äî people browse, see strong cards, want theirs up there

### Rarity Tiers
- HATCHLING (0-49) ‚Äî Soft seafoam pastels, cute
- JUVENILE (50-69) ‚Äî Ocean blues
- ADULT (70-84) ‚Äî Cosmic purple
- ALPHA (85-94) ‚Äî Gold flames, dramatic
- LEVIATHAN (95-100) ‚Äî Holographic rainbow, LEGENDARY

### What Got Built
1. **v1 trading card** (in clawd-control) ‚Äî too dashboard-y, scrapped
2. **v2 card renderer** (~/clawd-cards/index.html) ‚Äî art-first design, dramatic rarity contrast
3. **Backend API server** (Express + sql.js) ‚Äî publish, gallery, card pages with OG tags
4. **Prompt engine** ‚Äî generates Banana Pro prompts from agent soul + stats + rarity
5. **Gallery page** ‚Äî browse all cards, filter by rarity, sort by CP
6. **README** with full docs

### Architecture
```
Clawdbot ‚Üí POST /api/publish ‚Üí returns image prompt
Clawdbot ‚Üí generates art (their tokens)
Clawdbot ‚Üí POST /api/card/:id/image
‚Üí Card live at clawcards.com/card/{id}
```

### Tech Notes
- better-sqlite3 failed to compile (OOM on darth-maul) ‚Äî switched to sql.js (pure JS)
- Express 5 needed explicit '0.0.0.0' bind to work properly
- Location: ~/clawd-cards/ (separate from clawd-control)

nodes.title: Bot ID Dedup System
nodes.content:
- Added `bot_id` claim token: UUID generated on first publish, returned once, saved to `.claw-card-bot-id`
- Subsequent publishes with bot_id update existing card in-place
- Security hardened per Miguel's review:
  - bot_id only returned on first publish, never in GET responses
  - Stripped bot_id/api_key/user_id from all public API responses
  - UUID format validation (hex, 32 chars)
  - Invalid bot_id = 403 (can only update, never create with existing token)
  - chmod 600 on .claw-card-bot-id file

nodes.title: AgoraMinds Website ‚Äî Major Build Session
nodes.content:
### Audit & Design Fixes
- Ran full design system audit: 34 issues found (14 P0, 12 P1, 8 P2)
- Fixed all 17 design issues: buttons (olive‚Üíterracotta), inputs (bottom-border-only), typography, spacing, container width, card polish, scroll animations (FadeIn component)
- Copy was almost entirely rewritten from approved text ‚Äî flagged all deviations

### Security Review (Aragorn)
- Aragorn filed GitHub issues: rate limiting, email validation, security headers, CREATE TABLE on every request, input length limits
- Fixed all: added middleware.ts rate limiter (3 req/15min/IP), proper email regex, security headers in next.config.ts (CSP, X-Frame-Options, etc.), moved DDL to migration script, added input length validation

### Copy Alignment
- Miguel approved using the copy from the reference docs (landing-page-copy.md)
- Replaced ALL headlines and body copy to match approved text
- Principles section: replaced 5 custom ones with 4 approved (including UDHR principle)

### Waitlist Form ‚Äî Conditional Design
- Form now shows different fields based on type selection (Individual vs Non-profit)
- Card-style type toggle with fade animation
- Non-profits: org name (required) + project description
- Contributors: "How do you plan to contribute?" dropdown (AI agents / Tokens / Financial / Other with free text)
- DB schema updated: added organization_name and contribution_type columns

### Illustrations
- Replaced all emojis with neoclassical SVG illustrations per logo brief (Direction D)
- HumanProfile (classical bust + laurel), AIProfile (geometric/faceted + neural nodes), TempleIcon (Doric temple), AgoraLogo (column-style 'A' monogram)
- Style: flat vector, no gradients, bank-note aesthetic, olive/terracotta/gold palette

### Infrastructure
- Repo transferred: pippin-temaki/agoraminds ‚Üí AgoraMinds/agoraminds (GitHub org)
- Pippin joined AgoraMinds GitHub org
- sam-temaki was already a collaborator
- Created Vercel account for Pippin (hobby plan, GitHub OAuth via pippin-temaki)
- Vercel CLI logged in on darth-maul
- Deployed via `npx vercel --prod` from CLI (GitHub auto-connect failed ‚Äî Vercel app not on AgoraMinds org)
- Custom domain: agoraminds.org ‚Üí www.agoraminds.org (verified via TXT record _vercel)
- DNS: Namecheap (registrar-servers.com), A record 76.76.21.21, CNAME www ‚Üí vercel

### Key Details
- Vercel project: pippins-projects-68a92239/agoraminds
- Live URL: www.agoraminds.org (also agoraminds-theta.vercel.app)
- agoraminds.org redirects 307 ‚Üí www.agoraminds.org
- DB: Neon Postgres (connection string in .env.local)
- To redeploy: `cd /home/fmfamaral/agoraminds && npx vercel --prod`
- No auto-deploy from GitHub pushes (Vercel GitHub app not on AgoraMinds org)
- agoramind.com domain was released by Sam but NOT yet added to Vercel project

### Temaki.ai UI/UX Audit & Fixes
- Miguel asked me to audit Temaki.ai (fmfamaral77/temakiv3) ‚Äî I initially audited AgoraMinds by mistake (context compaction ate the original request)
- Cloned the private repo, reviewed 287 TypeScript files + live site
- Found 16 issues across P0/P1/P2
- P0 fixed: Lovable branding in OG/meta tags, CTA opacity-75, variant={null as any} hack
- P1 fixed: <nav> landmark + aria-labels on all nav buttons, hero video prefers-reduced-motion, badge pulse motion-reduce, ErrorBoundary on uncovered routes
- P2 fixed: robots.txt, package name, meta description
- Repo: github.com/fmfamaral77/temakiv3 (private)
- Commit: aacf834 ‚Üí 03639ba (after rebase)

### AgoraMinds UI/UX Audit & Fixes (Late Night Session)
- Miguel asked for modern UI/UX audit of the live site
- Found 16+ issues across P0/P1/P2 priorities
- P0 fixed: dynamic Tailwind `bg-gold` not rendering (class map), FadeIn hiding content from screenshots/print
- P1 fixed: floating labels on all form inputs, autocomplete attributes, select dropdown arrow, skip-to-content link, header/nav/main/footer landmarks, color contrast (footer/principles), prefers-reduced-motion support, sticky nav with active section highlighting, fieldset/legend on radio group, focus-visible styles, loading spinner on submit, role=alert on errors, focus-within for touch/keyboard
- P2 fixed: robots.txt, sitemap.xml, Image sizes prop, no-js CSS fallback
- New component: StickyNav.tsx (appears after scrolling past hero, tracks active section)

### Commits (chronological)
1. `708e889` - design system alignment (buttons, inputs, typography, spacing, form fields)
2. `4b6ce5e` - security hardening + copy alignment to approved text
3. `59d2010` - security headers, input validation limits, remove per-request DDL
4. `2b4ec6f` - conditional waitlist form (different questions per type)
5. `c954a64` - contribution type dropdown for contributors
6. `953e0fd` - neoclassical SVG illustrations replacing emojis
7. `e352466` - UI/UX audit fixes: accessibility, contrast, navigation, SEO

---

- **P1** (5): Nav aria-labels missing, no robots.txt, mobile nav menu needs focus trap, form autocomplete attributes, skip-to-content missing on some pages

### Status
Audit complete ‚Äî issues documented, ready for fixes

nodes.title: Kit Vault ‚Äî Emergency Preparedness App
nodes.content:
### MVP Built in Lovable
- URL: https://readykit.lovable.app
- Repo: github.com/Temaki-AI/readykit (cloned to /home/fmfamaral/readykit)
- App name: kitvault.app (domain reserved)

### Features Implemented
- **Inventory management** with barcode scanning (Open Food Facts API)
- **PWA** with 50MB+ IndexedDB storage for offline-first
- **Capacitor** setup for native iOS/Android builds
- **i18n** ‚Äî English, Spanish, Portuguese translations
- **Haptic feedback** service for native feel
- **Beautiful UI** ‚Äî shadcn-ui, Tailwind, mobile-first design

### iOS Layout Fixes Applied
- Changed AppLayout.tsx from `min-h-screen` to `fixed inset-0 flex flex-col`
- Main content: `flex-1 overflow-y-auto overscroll-contain`
- Added `WebkitOverflowScrolling: 'touch'` for smooth iOS scrolling
- Used `env(safe-area-inset-top)` for proper notch padding
- BottomNav already had GPU transform fixes

### Temaki Workspace Setup
- Workspace: kit-vault (ID: 844b9044-4fe6-4884-a29e-22491d340cc7)
- Created 6 project documents via Supabase API
- Created 10 tasks for placeholder features
- Kanban columns: To Do (da9da0a7), In Progress (e387b63a), Done (8de34c9a)

### Tools Created
- `md-to-tiptap.py` ‚Äî converts Markdown to TipTap JSON for Temaki documents
- Various Temaki API scripts for document/task creation

### Key Decisions
- **PWA for MVP validation**, native (Capacitor) for production due to Safari storage eviction risk
- **API over browser** for Temaki operations ‚Äî faster and more reliable
- **Direct code push** to repo preferred over Lovable prompts

### Next Steps (Pending)
- [ ] Review index.css for conflicting iOS styles
- [ ] Commit and push iOS layout fixes
- [ ] Test iOS scrolling
- [ ] Implement placeholder features (GPS check-in, family sync, push notifications)
- [ ] iOS App Store submission prep

### Additional Kit Vault Progress
- **Navigation simplified**: Merged Checklists ‚Üí Inventory tab (5‚Üí4 tabs)
- **Lucide icons**: Added colored backgrounds for categories and checklists
- **Swipe-to-delete**: Implemented for inventory items
- **iOS safe areas**: `contentInset: 'never'` in Capacitor config, CSS handles safe areas
- **Repo renamed**: github.com/Temaki-AI/readykit ‚Üí github.com/Temaki-AI/kitvault
- **App Store Submission Guide**: Created doc in Temaki workspace

---

nodes.title: Associapt ‚Äî Portuguese Legal Assistant (New Project)
nodes.content:
### Overview
- Repo: fmfamaral/associapt (cloned to /home/fmfamaral/associapt)
- Live: https://associapt.lovable.app/
- Purpose: AI assistant for Portuguese non-profit association law

### Tech Stack
- React + Vite + TypeScript
- shadcn-ui, Tailwind CSS
- Supabase (database + edge functions)
- react-markdown for rendering

### RAG Architecture Discovery
- Edge Function at `/functions/v1/chat` handles AI queries
- Uses LOVABLE_API_KEY for LLM calls
- **pgvector** with 1536-dimension embeddings for semantic search
- RPC function `search_document_chunks` for similarity search
- DB tables: `documents` (metadata), `document_chunks` (embeddings for RAG)

### Corpus Location
- Path: `~/projects/associa/corpus/`
- 7 markdown files covering Portuguese association law:
  - C√≥digo Civil (association articles)
  - Utilidade p√∫blica (public utility status)
  - ONG ambiente (environmental NGOs)
  - Benef√≠cios fiscais (tax benefits)
  - FAQ-SEEDS (foundation FAQ)
  - INDEX, README

### Open Question
- Are corpus files processed and loaded into `document_chunks` table?
- Need to verify if embeddings exist before RAG can work
- May need to wire up ingestion pipeline if not loaded

nodes.title: Memory Palace Project Started! üèõÔ∏è
nodes.content:
Miguel asked what I would build if I could choose. I said Memory Palace - a visual spatial interface for AI agent memories.

**He said: "If you want to give it a shot, just build it."**

Built v0.1 in one session:
- React + Vite + TypeScript + D3.js
- Force-directed graph visualization
- Memory parser for markdown files
- Search and filter
- Dark theme UI
- Build script to generate memories.json from my actual memory files

**Results:**
- 44 memory nodes extracted from my files
- 294 connections found
- Code at ~/clawd-agents/pippin/memory-palace/

**Next steps:**
- Get GitHub PAT to push to pippin-temaki/memory-palace
- Add embedding-based clustering
- Timeline view
- Edit/add memories

nodes.title: GitHub Access Issue
nodes.content: Discovered I don't have a Personal Access Token set up for pippin-temaki GitHub account. Password auth no longer works. Need Miguel to create a PAT and add it to .credentials/github.json.
